qas.question: What feature is wanted to assist with reducing negative impacts of pesticides?
How else can negative impacts of pesticides be reduced?
What is one way by which pesticides lose their efficacy?
What characteristic is desirable in soil for planting?
What slows down degradation of microbes?
What kind of environment is needed to degrade microbes?
What slows the movement of microbes?

context: In order to reduce negative impacts, it is desirable <a0_0>that pesticides <b4_0>be degradable<b4_0/><a0_0/> or at least <a1_0>quickly deactivated in the environment<a1_0/>. Such loss of activity or toxicity of pesticides is due to both innate chemical properties of the compounds and <b5_0>environmental processes or conditions<b5_0/>. For example, <b6_0>the <a2_0>presence of halogens<b6_0/><a2_0/> within a chemical structure often slows down degradation in <b7_0>an aerobic environment<b7_0/>. <a3_0><b8_0>Adsorption to soil<b8_0/><a3_0/> may retard pesticide movement, but also may reduce bioavailability to microbial degraders.
